comments.body: this is an incredibly good idea, isn't it? i'm not much of a redstoner but I understand biochemistry reaction chains, and too much of a product is sometimes a real bad thing. Fast disposal seems great

One of the reasons gold is such a valuable material in real life is because it doesn't oxidize.

Generalizing the aging system to all the blocks (where it would make sense) would be nice, though. Even if it would multiply the block count by quite a lot.
This would make sense for iron but not gold, as pure gold doesn't oxidize in real life.

This will remove the special feature off of copper and make it into another useless ore.
This is the same with copper stairs and slabs....
This is coppers thing though
exactly, even iron doesn't oxidise although it does rot
exactly, even iron doesn't oxidise although it does rot

iron oxidizes, it is called rust. Also, it would not oxidize at the same speed as copper, making it not remove copper's "thing." Also, copper has a cool color, and it can be used in the spyglass & lightning rod, which makes it not useless. In addition, iron is more valuable for armor and tools, so copper would be a better building alternative.
Pure gold doesn't oxidize but iron definitely should oxidize in game

I am a bit late to this. I agree with the fact that gold should not oxidize. 
However, I do think that the ability to get Iron to oxidize would be a cool feature. This would give a rusty brown color, useful for a lot of builds. Extra building blocks, made from already existing blocks, I think is a great idea.

On another note. I think that placing copper near gold should make copper oxidize faster, as it would in real life, as well at copper will oxidize slower near iron. :)

There should be a stairs, slabs, and wall update.
399058914632 there sort of already was one, in Village and Pillage, they added 16 new types of slabs and 14 types of stairs. Isn't that enough?

I disagree with the idea that just because there are some walls (or slabs), we can't have anymore. I think that builders such as myself find inspiration from the opportunities given by as many new and interesting blocks as possible, particularly slabs, walls and stairs which allow the block to be utilised in all kinds of manners. For this reason, I think there is always a good principle to put in these stairs etc. that correspond to blocks.

Furthermore, I don't think it's fair to give the comparison to 1.14, as this mainly expanded stone variants, which has a completely different set of colours and textures to the stone slabs (which already need expanding on, but that's a different topic).
how about concrete of this 2, I mean even walls!!
I mostly agree, but maybe there should be decorative variants of these blocks (that require 4 ingots instead of 9), and those variants have slabs, stairs, etc.

I also feel that the waxing sound needs to be loud so that if someone accidentally waxed the copper, they'd know it, and be able to un-wax.
This is something that I hope to see so that I can build a copper structure and have the oxidation in different stages without having to prepare all the different blocks before hand.

Although this isn't a bad idea, it is much more time consuming to do when you have multiple block you have to wax. I mean, if you're tryna make a Copper House, the waxing of copper by right clicking would take a really long time, as opposed to waxing whole stacks in crafting tables/grids

Good!

This would be perfect for setting up sculk sensors to detect a specific sound. Right now, even if you have a setup that only allows certain signal strengths through, simply walking nearby it still activates the sculk sensor which means that it can't detect anything else for 2 seconds, so sculk sensors are still very susceptible to interference that might cause it to miss the vibration you're actually looking for.

For example, what if you wanted to detect when someone shot a projectile? Well, they would have to walk into the sculk sensor's range, which would activate it, leaving you with 2 full seconds of absolutely no detection every time they took a step in it's radius. You would have to manually try to stop the interference by standing still for 2 seconds then shooting, which kinda defeats the purpose. And it will be pretty much impossible to use in mob farms because the overwhelming amount of walking vibrations will keep it constantly activated even if that signal is going nowhere.

Walking is the big problem here but I think it should also muffle the Hit Ground and Projectile Land events.
That makes a lot of sense!
I like the idea, but maybe a new mob could be there too, a monster wich can withstand the heat and attack the player

YES!!! I've always thought of the Wandering Trader as some sort of exotic item collector and this would be a perfect way to make him more loved. Having him request specific variants of clay shards, amethyst crystals, music discs, and other rare, valuable, non-farmable items in exchange for emeralds would make a lot more sense than selling seeds (he could still keep those kinds of trades, just have them balanced out with more valuable things as well.)
This and have him have offers based on what biome you are currently at and have not or least visited. I don't want to buy Oak Saplings where Oak is plentiful where I am settling in.

It should be made into tools, it should be as durable as iron, a little stronger than stone. Then iron should be more durable so it's closer to diamond but not the same. And iron should spawn deeper and less likely to be found in loot. Then the balance of ores is more restored.

Diamonds should also have their rarity increased, for as rare as they are supposed to be, they really aren't. Copper should be between stone and iron, closer to iron.

I'm not familiar with cubic chunks, however from your post I think that they would kind of work with an update Idea I was thinking about. Render distance should have a separate slider for vertical and horizontal and by default prioritize the loading of horizontal chunks before vertical ones. This way when you load areas it loads the 16 blocks above and below you until you hit 8x8 chunks (for example number could change)  around you. Only after that number got hit would it start generating or loading up and down another 16 blocks.

I know it would probably be much harder than my quick example but i think it would have the potential for a substantial performance increase.
Agree with the statement above. Still, there is a downward fall in the Game, which should not freeze, if possible.

YES though it lost, it would have been amazing to still see this mob in the game because it fits in so perfectly with the Caves&Cliffs update and it would be another mob to possibly participate in raids(maybe in cold biomes and places over y=160).

In a recent "AskMojang" episode, even one of the developers said that the losing mob & biome votes since 2018 would come eventually when it fits with a particular future update. But I just can't see there being another update anytime soon where the iceologer would fit in. It fits with 1.17 the most, just like Alchemist33352 said on this post. It seemed like most of the developers were hoping for the iceologer to win anyways, and yet a useless mob won. It would make a lot more people happy if they just added it with this update anyways. There would also be a lot less hate in the community that boiled within those weeks. Many people were afraid the iceologer would be another phantom, but it just has to be developed right. It doesn't even fly. That would be a real nice thing from the developers to the community.
Glow squids makes me cry why not the iceolger

Don't even get us started with the possibility of there being Dream stan Alt accounts just to get extra votes when Minecon's voting poll began. I think the Iceologer making an appearance as a "voting Dishonesty Penalty" would be the perfect, especially for being a mob for the mountains, and If developed right won't be as painful as the phantom.
Vote iceologer please send my game
If we added losing mobs there would be no point to a vote, and it would set a bad precedent for future votes.

While it may sound like a bad Idea for few to add the Iceologer anyway, again, I'd like to see this being done as a reasonable "voting penalty", adding a mob that failed a rigged vote. If the votes are Rigged to be something the community doesn't want by certain people such as dream or other youtubers, the mobs should be added anyway in order to remove all that toxicity and to settle down the huge community that is at war with a public figure.

Also why has no one acknowledged the possibility that maybe it wasn't just glow squid voters that made alternate accounts? Or the fact that multiple other youtubers influenced their fans in the same way for the iceologer? No, of course no one acknowledges this because the glow squid won and people wanted someone to blame, while never once considering that maybe people were scared to vote for the iceologer because they didn't want it to turn out like the phantom did, or because they thought it would actually glow, or because they just liked the mob.

If you need someone to blame, blame mojang for lying to us that the squid would glow. But we don't need someone to blame. The glow squid won and the iceologer will likely never be added because that would undermine the current voting system.

 

I would just like everyone to answer this one question. If a losing mob is added to the game, what is the point of holding a vote?
There is no reason not to add the lost mobs to the game.
